with your indication of the new Function (W=

--- In archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> Hello Virginie=
,
> 
> The constructors were changed in this checkin:
> https://webarchive.=
jira.com/source/changelog/HER?cs=3D7047
> 
> Using heritrix 3.1.0-RC1 or 3.=
1.0-SNAPSHOT you can approximate the old 
> behavior of your program like s=
o:
> 
> WARCWriterPoolSettings settings =3D new WARCWriterPoolSettingsData(=
prefix, 
> WriterPoolMember.DEFAULT_TEMPLATE, 
> WARCConstants.DEFAULT_MAX_=
WARC_FILE_SIZE, compressed, dirs, l, new 
> UUIDGenerator());
> WARCWriter =
writer =3D new WARCWriter(aint, settings);
> 
> One difference here is the =
use of a template for the warc filenames. If 
> you need to maintain your e=
xisting naming convention, then you'll have 
> to reconstruct the template =
and include your suffix in it. Then supply 
> your template to the WARCWrit=
erPoolSettingsData constructor instead of 
> WriterPoolMember.DEFAULT_TEMPL=
ATE.
> 
> There's some more information on that in the release notes:
> htt=
ps://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Release+Notes+-+Heritrix+3.1=
.0-RC1#ReleaseNotes-Heritrix3.1.0-RC1-NewformulaanddefaultconventionsforARC=
%2FWARCnamingtobetterguaranteeuniqueness%28HER1727%29
> 
> Noah
> 
>

 Code with the method

);
